Not sure I follow.  Are you suggesting to pass the class under test as
a pa=
rameter to a factory via the test constructor?  From what I've
seen, parame=
terized tests seem aimed in a very different direction. 
Could you point us=
 to discussion or examples of this usage?  

I can see some potential conve=
nience for abstract classes and
interfaces representing the primary type of=
 each implementation,
provided the family resemblance manifests itself in a=
 common
constructor signature.  For "mixin" interfaces, uniformity of
const=
ructors seems less likely. The specter of type-switching logic
creeping int=
o the factory seems likely to undermine not only
convenience but cleanlines=
s.  As I said, maybe elaboration or examples
from someone more experienced =
in this area than I am would help.

Thanks,
Lance
